Sept. 14, 1912 D West of England Bandsmen's Festival (Class B)
West of England Bandsmen's Festival (Class B) 510 Test Piece Contest West of England Bandsmen's Festival (Bugle) west-of-england-bandsmen-s-festival-class-b
None
Apollo
Peniel Farm, Bugle, Cornwall, England, UK Prizes 1st £7 and cup valued £5.5s., 2nd £5, 3rd £3.
Best Cornet: G. H. Wilson (Indian Queens) Best Trombone: Ford Knight (Indian Queens) Best Horn: C. Tamblyn (Mount Charles Youth/Junior) Best Euphonium : J. Tanner (Lelant)
Contest restricted to bands of 16 or fewer players.
6 bands competed.
1st Annual West of England Bandsmans Festival.
Oct. 13, 2012, 9:59 p.m. May 13, 2013, 12:54 p.m.
1 Indian Queens Silver George Henry Wilson
2 St Ives Town Edwin J. Williams Snr
3 Lelant John Tanner
4 St. Agnes Silver Band Harry Robins
5 Foxhole Silver J. Stubbs
6 St. Breward Silver Band W. J. Hawken
